ae.utils package

Submodules

ae.utils.cli_helper module

async ae.utils.cli_helper.answer_questions_over_cli(questions: list[str]) → dict[str, str]

Asks a question over the command line and awaits the user’s response.

Parameters: - questions: A list of questions to ask the user, e.g., [“What is your favorite site?”, “What do you want to search for?”].

Returns: - A dictionary where each key is a question and each value is the user’s response.

ae.utils.cli_helper.async_input(prompt: str) → Future

Display a prompt to the user and wait for input in an asynchronous manner.

Parameters: - prompt: The message to display to the user.

Returns: - A Future object that will be fulfilled with the user’s input.

ae.utils.dom_helper module

async ae.utils.dom_helper.wait_for_non_loading_dom_state(page: Page, max_wait_millis: int)

ae.utils.get_detailed_accessibility_tree module

async ae.utils.get_detailed_accessibility_tree.do_get_accessibility_info(page: Page, only_input_fields: bool = False)

Retrieves the accessibility information of a web page and saves it as JSON files.

Parameters:

  • page (Page) – The page object representing the web page.

  • only_input_fields (bool, optional) – If True, only retrieves accessibility information for input fields. Defaults to False.

Returns:

The enhanced accessibility tree as a dictionary, or None if an error occurred.

Return type:

dict[str, Any] or None

async ae.utils.get_detailed_accessibility_tree.get_dom_with_accessibility_info() → dict[str, Any] | None

Retrieves, processes, and minifies the Accessibility tree of the active page in a browser instance. Strictly follow the name and role tag for any interaction with the nodes.

Returns: - The minified JSON content of the browser’s active page.

async ae.utils.get_detailed_accessibility_tree.get_element_attributes(page: Page, mmid: str, attributes: list[str])
async ae.utils.get_detailed_accessibility_tree.get_node_dom_element(page: Page, mmid: str)
ae.utils.get_detailed_accessibility_tree.is_space_delimited_mmid(s: str) → bool

Check if the given string matches the the mmid pattern of number space repeated.

Parameters: - s (str): The string to check against the pattern.

Returns: - bool: True if the string matches the pattern, False otherwise.

ae.utils.js_helper module

ae.utils.js_helper.escape_js_message(message: str) → str

Escape a message for use in JavaScript code.

Parameters:

message (str) – The message to escape.

Returns:

The escaped message.

Return type:

str

ae.utils.logger module

ae.utils.logger.set_log_level(level: str | int) → None

Set the log level for the logger.

Parameters: - level (Union[str, int]): A string or logging level such as ‘debug’, ‘info’, ‘warning’, ‘error’, or ‘critical’, or the corresponding logging constants like logging.DEBUG, logging.INFO, etc.
